content.title: Nirman Shramik Kalyan Yojana
content.department: Labour and Employee's State Insurance Department, Government of Odisha
content.details: The scheme 'Nirman Shramik Kalyan Yojana' was launched by the Labour and Employee's State Insurance Department, Government of Odisha. The objective of the scheme is to extend financial assistance to eligible building and other construction workers for continuing education of their wards/children under the 'Nirman Shramik Kalyan Yojana' being extended by the Odisha Building and Other Construction Workers Welfare Board.
benefits: For Class- 6th and 7th to girl child: ₹2,000/- per annum
For Class- 8th to all children: ₹2,000/- per annum with 20% additional benefit to girl child
For Class- 9th to all children: ₹3,000/- per annum with 20% additional benefit to girl child
For Class- 10th to all children: ₹4,000/- per annum with 20% additional benefit to girl child
Cash award to the children securing 90% or above in Class-10th: ₹10,000/- (One time) with 20% additional benefit to girl child
For Class – 11th/12th: ₹5,000/- per annum with 20% additional benefit to girl child
For Classes of B.A./B.Sc./ B.Com./PG Studies: ₹7,000/- per annum with 20% additional benefit to girl child

For B. Tech/ MCA/ MBA/ B. Arch./ M. Arch./ M.Tech/ M. Sc./ B. Pharm/ M. Pharm/ Hotel Management & Catering Services/ Medical in Govt. Colleges only: ₹40,000/- per annum with 20% additional benefit to girl child
For B.Ed / CT/ Nursing Training in Govt. Institutes: ₹10,000/- per annum with 20% additional benefit to girl child
eligibility: The wards/children of the building and other construction workers are eligible to apply under the scheme.
The financial assistance is given to only the wards/children of such building and other construction beneficiaries who have completed at least one year as registered beneficiaries under the Board.
Financial assistance under the scheme is being extended to students from class 6th onwards.
A maximum of two children of a family are eligible to get the assistance.
For 6th and 7th standard the scheme is applicable only in respect of girl children; whereas for class 8th onwards the scheme is applicable to both girls and boys.
content.application_process: Online. For new users, click on the Registration link on the Scholarship Portal. Existing users can click on the ‘Login’ button and enter the Aadhaar number to proceed.
documents_required: A copy of Aadhaar Card of the applicant
Mark Sheets/Certificate of last qualifying examination
Aadhaar Card of the parent registered with the OB&OCWW Board
Building and Other Construction ID Card
First page of the bank account of the registered building and other construction worker (parent) containing account number and IFSC
College ID card issued by the concerned authority or Admission receipt/Library Card/Letter of Undertaking from the concerned college authority

faqs.question: What is the objective of the scheme?
faqs.answer: The objective of the scheme is to extend financial assistance to eligible building and other construction workers for continuing education of their wards/children.

faqs.question: Which is the implementing department of this scheme?
faqs.answer: Labour and Employee's State Insurance Department, Government of Odisha.

faqs.question: How much amount of scholarship is paid under scheme?
faqs.answer: The scholarship under the scheme is given to the children from ₹2,000/- to ₹40,000/- per annum as per the eligibility criteria.

faqs.question: When will the students receive the scholarship?
faqs.answer: The students will receive the scholarship on completion of 1st year of course.

faqs.question: How much is the additional benefit given to the girl child under the scheme?
faqs.answer: 20% additional benefit to girl child of beneficiary over and above normal assistance.

faqs.question: Who is eligible to apply under the scheme?
faqs.answer: The wards/children of building and other construction workers are eligible to apply under the scheme.

faqs.question: Students of which classes can apply for this scheme?
faqs.answer: The students who are studying in Class 6th to Post-graduation can apply under the scheme.

faqs.question: How many children in a family can avail of the benefit of the scheme?
faqs.answer: A maximum of two children of a family are eligible to get the assistance.

faqs.question: Can both boys & girls get assistance under the scheme?
faqs.answer: For 6th and 7th standard the scheme is applicable only in respect of girl children; whereas for class 8th onwards the scheme is applicable to both girls and boys.

faqs.question: How to apply under the scheme?
faqs.answer: The eligible candidate can apply for the scheme through Odisha State Scholarship Portal.
